Working elliptically and with remarkable economy of means, the playwright creates a portrait in miniature of a society that, all too often, leaves the poor, disabled, and psychologically lost to fend for themselves. At the same time, her dialogue crackles with wit and understated feeling. It's a piece that needs extremely special handling, here provided by director Jo Bonney, recreating her 2017 MTC production with three members of the original cast.
